result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Meherg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 61 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample  & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,741.17 plus surcharges.

CR-247 Confidential Crime Victim Information
Proposed Restitution Order
For Restitution Order
of DNA Collection at Conviction

Of Completion of Representation
Submitted by Atty Ian Mickelson
Deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State, by zoom. Defendant in custody by zoom w/ Attorney I Mickelson. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court reporter by zoom. Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing is being held via video conferencing. Deft pleads guilty. Court finds deft guilty. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; credit for 61 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $1,741.17 (by stipulation of deft). If restitution paid early the court does not oppose early termination from probation.
